======================================================================
Rejane Cassia Eller had a musical career rather important, albeit short, with something around ten own albums recorded during the twelve-year career. In fact, only in 1989 his career took off. Helped by his uncle, recorded a demo tape with the song "Meanwhile" by Renato Russo. This same uncle took the tape to PolyGram, which resulted in the hiring of Cascia by the record. His first appearance on record was in 1990, in Wagner Tiso LP titled "Baobab".
Cassia Eller has always had a very intense stage presence, assumed preference for albums recorded live and she was constantly asked for cameos and interpretations custom, unique, custom.
Another important feature is the fact that it has assumed a position of interpreter declared, having made just three of the songs recorded: "Lullaby" (partnership with MÃƒÂ¡rcio Faraco) on his first album, Cassia Eller, 1990 (LP with 60,000 copies sold mainly due to the success of the track "Meanwhile" by Renato Russo): "They" (with Luiz Pinheiro and her Tavinho Fialho) and "The Marginal" (with her Hermelino Neder, ZÃƒÂ© Luiz Pinheiro and Mark), on the second disc , The Marginal (1992).
Assumed was bisexual since early adolescence.
Characterized by the deep voice and the musical eclecticism, played songs of great composers of Brazilian rock, as Cazuza and Russo, and MPB artists like Caetano Veloso and Chico Buarque, through pop Nando Reis and unusual Arrigo BarnabÃƒÂ© and Solomon Wally until sambas RiachÃƒÂ£o rocks and classic Janis Joplin, Jimi Hendrix, Rita Lee, Beatles, John Lennon, and Nirvana.
